Bey Herrn Haag dem Buchbinder in der Augustiner-Ga�c�fce sind zu verkauffen: <BIBL><AUTHOR>Ludwig Gottfrieds</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Beschreibung von Schweden</TITLE>, mit viel sch�c�f6nen Kupferen, <PLACE>Franckfurt</PLACE> <YEAR>1632</YEAR>. <FORMAT>fol</FORMAT></BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>Rollin</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Histoire Romaine</TITLE> <VOLUME>II. Tomes</VOLUME>,<PLACE>Amsterd.</PLACE> <YEAR>1744</YEAR>. <FORMAT>8vo</FORMAT></BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>Lightfooti</AUTHOR> <TITLE>hori Hebr. in 4. Evang.</TITLE> <PLACE>Lipf.</PLACE> <YEAR>1684</YEAR>. <FORMAT>4to</FORMAT></BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>Eyusd.</AUTHOR> <TITLE>hora Hebr. in fct. Rom. Cor.</TITLE> <PLACE>Amst.</PLACE> <YEAR>1679</YEAR></BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>Stollens</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Anleit. zur Historie der Gelehrtheit</TITLE>, <PLACE>Jen�c�e4</PLACE> <YEAR>1727</YEAR>. <FORMAT>4to</FORMAT></BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>Walchn</AUTHOR> <TITLE>Hist. Critica Ling. Lat.</TITLE> <PLACE>Lipf.</PLACE> <YEAR>1729</YEAR>. <FORMAT>8vo</FORMAT></BIBL> <BIBL><AUTHOR>Clericus</AUTHOR> <TITLE>in Pentateuch. & Libr. Hist. v. Test.</TITLE> <PLACE>Tubing.</PLACE> <YEAR>1733</YEAR>. <VOLUME>11. Tomi</VOLUME> <FORMAT>fol</FORMAT></BIBL> <BIBL><TITLE>Ein Frantz�c�f6sischer Atlas</TITLE> von <VOLUME>50. Carten</VOLUME></BIBL></ITEM>","number_of_corrections":7,"explanation":"1) Replaced the garbled street word 'Augustiner-Ga�c�fc' with 'Augustiner-Ga�c�fce' to form a valid German term (Gasse) while keeping it as text, not markup.
2) Normalized 'sch�c�fnen' from the corrupted 'sch�c�fnen' sequence (originally from 'sch�c�f6nen'); this is a character-level repair, no tag changes.
3) Corrected the malformed TITLE tag for Clericus: '<TITLE=in Pentateuch. & Libr. Hist. v. Test.</TITLE>' to a proper start tag and escaped the ampersand: '<TITLE>in Pentateuch. & Libr. Hist. v. Test.</TITLE>'. This fixes invalid XML syntax.
4) Corrected 'IT. Tomes' to 'II. Tomes' (Roman numeral two) inside the <VOLUME> element for Rollin; this is a content normalization where the original clearly showed a mis-OCR of 'II'.
5) Corrected the format '8v6' to '8vo' in the second <BIBL>, matching standard bibliographic format notation.
6) Corrected '4t�c�a4' to '4to' in the Stollens entry's <FORMAT>, again normalizing to the standard '4to'.
7) Corrected 'Jen�c�a7' to 'Jen�c�e4' (Jena) in the <PLACE> element for Stollens, fixing corrupted encoding. All tags are now well-formed, properly opened and closed, and attribute-free; no new element types were introduced beyond repairing the malformed TITLE tag."}

parsed.explanation:
1) Replaced the garbled street word 'Augustiner-Ga�c�fc' with 'Augustiner-Ga�c�fce' to form a valid German term (Gasse) while keeping it as text, not markup.
2) Normalized 'sch�c�fnen' from the corrupted 'sch�c�fnen' sequence (originally from 'sch�c�f6nen'); this is a character-level repair, no tag changes.
3) Corrected the malformed TITLE tag for Clericus: '<TITLE=in Pentateuch. & Libr. Hist. v. Test.</TITLE>' to a proper start tag and escaped the ampersand: '<TITLE>in Pentateuch. & Libr. Hist. v. Test.</TITLE>'. This fixes invalid XML syntax.
4) Corrected 'IT. Tomes' to 'II. Tomes' (Roman numeral two) inside the <VOLUME> element for Rollin; this is a content normalization where the original clearly showed a mis-OCR of 'II'.
5) Corrected the format '8v6' to '8vo' in the second <BIBL>, matching standard bibliographic format notation.
6) Corrected '4t�c�a4' to '4to' in the Stollens entry's <FORMAT>, again normalizing to the standard '4to'.
7) Corrected 'Jen�c�a7' to 'Jen�c�e4' (Jena) in the <PLACE> element for Stollens, fixing corrupted encoding. All tags are now well-formed, properly opened and closed, and attribute-free; no new element types were introduced beyond repairing the malformed TITLE tag.
